review_title: Learning & Development, both internal courses and external courses, are non-existent
pros:
1) Colleagues at my level are very friendly and supportive.
2) Pension contribution from TotalEnergies Gas & Power is above industry standard.
cons:
1) Training and Development is non-existent, outside of internal training related to TGP systems and changes to credit policies from the Senior Management Team (SMT), these are not transferable skills.
2) Stretch Opportunities are solely at the discretion of your manager and not mandated and followed through on your objectives, therefore these can take potentially years to complete, which is unacceptably slow.
3) Lack of Clear Transparency on the credit strategy, credit risk appetite, and credit risk mitigation for certain customers that is cascaded from SMT, making the role challenging.
4) Credit Check List is not clearly defined and subject to a lot of interpretation, this should be harmonised and written down to determine best practice and adapted over time rather than via word of mouth from management.

review_title: Overall this is one of the better companies I have worked for in my 24 year career.
pros:
TotalEnergies is a great place to work and the pay is good. The company invest in employees, there are many opportunities for training including leadership and coaching for managers. 
Work is challenging and complex which keeps you interested and never bored. Every day is different and you always learn something new.
The company is making more efforts to provide opportunity to move around within the different affiliate companies. The tools available for internal job search are very helpful. Your soft skills as well as technical skills are taken into consideration providing more opportunities to move around the company. TotalEnergies has a multi-cultural environment with management stressing respect for all employees. When the Oil and Gas industry was struggling and laying off, Total did not lay off people. Overall this is definitely one of the better companies I have worked for in my 24 year career.
cons: A lot of the upper management positions will be filled by Expats from Europe which only stay 2 to 3 years. While there may not be layoffs there are areas that have been outsourced to save money. Typically the outsourcing of groups does include layoffs or loss of jobs. In the US Total runs lean and continues to reduce budget every year. In the US one person does the work of 5 individuals, while in France this does not tend to be the same. A lot of positions are filled with contractors to reduce cost.

review_title: I happy to work for Total
pros:
- Total is an awesome place to work: fun colleagues, exciting work/projects, great benefits and work/life balance.
- Despite the old industry, Total is extremely innovative in their approach to solving problems. Innovation is encourage throughout the company very rarely do I here 'that's now how we used to do it'. New ideas and ways are always welcomed.
- Colleagues are from all over the world - some of the smartest I've ever worked with, extremely knowledgeable in their respective fields which gives me a lot to learn from. As an engineer its very easy for me to reach out to a subject matter experts in different parts of the world to seek help/guidance on a particular issue. 
-Total is continuously growing and has some very exciting work going on around the world. If you're open to expat opportunities Total can provide for a very dynamic career path.
cons:
-Despite being among the majors, very few people know of Total in the US. Not enough work is being done on brand recognition.
-Tight on spending
-For as international as Total is, sometimes it does feel overwhelmingly French - especially on a managerial level. Yet the gradual shift from being a French company to a more globally inclusive company is evident and noticeable. I've noticed a more international mix throughout the managerial ranks than before.

pros: great company to work for
cons: there is none to my knowledge

pros: Salary is above average for hourly and most exempt employees. Decent benefits comparable with rivals in the sector. A really good 401k/cash balance pension plan for newer employees. 9/80 work schedule and good job stability in tough economic times.
cons: Whew where to start. Overall its a European run company and their global decisions are not always best for each region. The atmosphere here on the gulf coast is very different from Europe right now. The perception within the company is that non French employees are treated like second class citizens. The focus on cost control is so intense that they have cut and consolidated many positions and the consequences are showing up in the form of injuries, fatalities,  and near miss incidents.  Within the next 2-5 years the company will have a major release or explosion at one of the plant sites that will include fatalities. A visit to the plants exposes you to the epitome of the good ol' boy network. If you're part of the clique, then you are well taken care of, otherwise you are expendable. Employee turnover is rampant at all levels of the organization. Mediocrity is encouraged by not adequately rewarding high performers.

pros: management, approach to work, flexibility, strong targets, fast pace
cons: Location is not great. City centre would have been a better option.

review_title: Good Experience, Great Co-Workers, But Career Limited And Re-Organization Affects Morale
pros: Lots of talented, well educated co-workers. Get lots of responsibility and training here.   Most people work in offices which have doors, about 30% in cubes.  Centralized downtown location,  company also pays for metro park and ride bus passes, good 401k matching, great medical insurance, and fitness club subsidy at nearby downtown ymca.  Salary levels are targeted to be in 60% of big energy company ranges with another 5% to 10% added at end of year as potential bonus. Some middle level jobs have international travel opportunities.
cons:
Business environment is working against the European side of the chemicals business for the next 5 years and likely further cost cutting there will probably be felt in the US.  Expecting to see cost reductions on US side in the next 12 months which will affect the average employee in areas of bonus, training, travel, salary, and staffing levels.

The recent reorganization moved many people into jobs they did not prefer to have and has resulted in turnover with positions not being replaced. Some areas in US are understaffed resulting in occasional or even frequent heavy workload.

Excessive amount of power points, justifications, and long term planning.  Decision making is slow, even more so because of foreign management culture.

review_title: An exciting company to work for and truly make a difference
pros: Total operates a truly integrated model in the energy sector meaning there are career opportunities at every stage of the energy value chain, and a full spectrum of support functions. Total offers international career opportunities with its worldwide presence and very strong HR and expatriation frameworks. Remuneration is market fair for salary and advantageous when taking the full package into account. The management listen to staff, engagement is measured biannually and action plans communicated. Strategy is influenced from a bottom up collaborative approach (eg "One Total" initiative to capture our collective views on the business ambition for 20 years). Most of all: we all need energy. It is essential for modern life. Working for Total enables us to lead a global drive to innovate towards better, safer, cleaner, more accessible energy.
cons: Total is a large multinational with a heavy HQ. Working in affiliates can be dynamic, fast paced, and relatively autonomous, however head office is a more hierarchical and process oriented environment. This is countered by the helicopter view and big picture perspective you get from a headquarters role, but can sometimes be a little frustrating.

review_title: Don't work there if you have a family or planning to have family
pros:
- Benefits are good if you manage to use them 
- Expat opportunities if you REALLY want to leave the country you are currently in
cons:
- extremely demanding work hours and strong pressures from management (the works were mostly caused by the disorganization or lack of communication of sr management)
- Local Canadian beware!  You will be expected to work the same hours as the expat (but without the benefits); extremely long hours and it's not common to have meeting starting at 5 pm or 6 pm (without any advance notice)
- expat opportunities are available BECAUSE the company needs you to be in those places.  Chances are these places/countries are dangerous or unstable and if you turn it down enough times, there is a good chance you will not go anywhere in the company or even get fired....... (don't think this applies to the Canadians yet, but this is the corporate policy regarding expat assignments)
- lack of communication or cooperation between departments and non-management staff are always stuck in the middle of the power struggles 
- HR policies might seem to support work life balance, but it certainly has NOT been encouraged by management

**There are a lot of other opportunities available in Calgary with other O&G companies while you can still spend time with your family and friends**

pros: Total overall is a good technical oil companies. Diversity in operation around the world and internal experts make it good place to learn especially for graduates. cons:

pros: benefits, culture, free food, flexibility, good salary

review_title: Like to travel?  You've come to the right place....
pros:
Travel abroad:  one of the main reasons I joined Total was the opportunity to see the world.   International mobility is a prerequisite for anyone considering working for Total.
Work/life balance is quite good at Total....I've never seen a project get sacrificed for someone's summer 5-week vacation!
cons:
Coming from the ex-Total group (remember that Total purchased Fina then Elf), the new group certainly has the 'critical mass' to compete with its industry peers, but the overall level of responsibility for a given experience level has dropped dramatically compared to pre-merger days.    
It is felt by the majority of those coming from the ex-Total employees that we have entered into more of a 'study group' where much time and $ is spent on studies for 'studies sake'.
- The company plays well the 'monopoly' on french-based employees:  as they have a job for life (excepting any gross professional misconduct), the salary reflects that point and as a result is much lower than any non-French oil company.

review_title: Great people, just a few bad apples selectively placed can spoil it for long term growth/career
job_title: Technical Service Engineer in Houston, TX
pros: The Research and Technology center was a rewarding place to grow iniitally. The ISRS and Modern safety management is probably in the upper quartile. Technical service is very challenging with many chances to learn client's processes and TOTAL's internal workings. The stock option purchase plans were great as well as the 401k. 3 weeks vacation at the start was also nice.
cons: It was all about reports and not about substance: call reports, project reports, monthly reports, weekly reports, telephone call reports and more. The second-hand perception of what a client thought and not what the client was actually thinking was how I was graded. Pretty convoluted! supervisors need training in HR skills. Great technically, but half in supervision are glorified chemists or technologists and should stay in their specialties not in management.  EXPAT's are favored over all others. Many felt we were passed over unless we went overseas on assignment. Even those positions were very selective. I only knew one in our group that had been assigned overseas for a couple of years. the pay is capped at the midpoint for petrochemicals and refining industry. the work load increased with minimal bonuses and raises during my tenure.

pros: Overall, the company is very stable and offers decent compensation compared to other companies. Internal/lateral movement is encouraged and training is generally readily available. If you're nearing the end of your career and don't want any responsibilities, then this would be an excellent place to retire with minimal stress. The benefits are good (401(k) match, vacation, medical, etc.) but there wasn't an employee stock purchase option or even stock options.
cons: Bonuses are highly contingent on how well/poorly the company (as a whole) does, so bonuses are almost nothing some years. Moving up from one job scale "band" to another is almost impossible after being hired, so ALWAYS negotiate for one level beyond whatever you're initially offered. Company tends to move and make decisions very slowly. Most decisions are made out of France and they look down upon Americans as 2nd class citizens, so there is little opportunity for creativity/innovation.

review_title: Experience galore with a hard glass ceiling.
pros: Each production site is a close knit, high functioning team.  Lean staffing practices will challenge young talent early.  Recent efforts around establishing rigorous business practices have been painful but, will pay off in the long term.
cons: Senior leadership is comprised of expatriates who have little understanding of the US workplace/workforce and tenured Americans who have lost touch with that same workforce.  Above a certain level, promotional opportunities are not available without expatriation although, those Americans who have expatriated do not fare any better concerning promotional opportunities.  Business strategy is Euro-centric.  Market intelligence that doesn't align with European projections is summarily dismissed.  Significant regrettable departures in last 2 years at all levels of the organization.

review_title: Enjoyed my time but growth was stunted
pros: opportunities for advancement if willing to do ex-pat, fair compensation, Insurance and 401K were very good, modified flex-schedule was nice, centrally located in downtown, paid for parking or bus fare for employees who had to commute, opportunities to travel globally.
cons: good-old-boys-club. if you don't know someone near the top of management your growth will definitely be stunted. it takes a long time to often make simple decisions (due partially to sheer size and cultural approach to various decisions). Also, advancement is possible but perception is that to get promoted into management you have to do an expat assignment (usually in france).

pros: Good, Solid company with good values.  Good to work for.
cons: HR is underqualified, incompetent and very manipulative.  They make empty promises for future positions.  Double standards, some people implement strong ethical values, some just dont.  Management just throws a blind eye to this.  Corruption will be a part of Total for as long as they do not implement strong discipline and do not conduct financial and procurement audits.  They do not advertise career opportunities, people are employed without following a proper recruitment process and they only work through agencies.

review_title: Total is a great and caring company.  Well worth it to work for them...
pros: Great place to work.  Everyone is extremely friendly and caring.  Company is caring and is strongly involved in improving the quality and safety of the refinery.  If I get a chance to work for them again, I definitely wouldn't hesitate.
cons: Old office building but safe and protected from potential accidents from neighboring refinery.  Alkylation unit is extremely close to the parking lot and with the right wind, chemical exhausted from the Alky unit could potentially damage your car.  Luckily you can park on the other side which is a bit farther from the Alky unit but still close enough for chemicals to damage it.  Not many cons about Total.  Good and caring company.

pros: Good pay, good training, on the job knowledge transfer in some affiliates
cons: Slow progression of ideas and innovation. If an idea doesn't come from one regarded as an expert, it's not taken. The school you graduated from determines your career progression. Too much office politics and sucking up to bosses to move up the ladder than appreciation for work delivery.  He who doesn't work as hard can be better appraised than the hard worker. A lot of incompetent middle management that got positions based on politics. Gossip also seems to be a part of the culture. Technical contest of ideas are taken as disrespect, I guess that's why they are not the number 1 in the O & G industry.

job_title: Senior Process Engineer in Port Arthur, TX
pros: Great challenging assignments; very good work environment; true work life balance; if you do your job very well (high ratings) you will be highly and rapidly compensated; multiple opportunities for advancement within the plant; there has been improvement in HR vacations and family leave policies (maternity leave, paternity leave, part time and work from home) that really makes a difference.
cons: Can be bit unstructured compared to other oil majors, great fit for those how have a more fluid nature. The company truly reflects the French culture, this can be an issue with certain personalities. There was poor management communication for career and company strategy in the past and they are truly working on improving this area.

pros:
- Total thinks long-term and is frugal (sometimes too) with its spending decisions.
- Total treats employees well.
- Total has a good share program to invest in and matching (up to a limit) 401k.
- Total invests into the future on worldwide projects.
cons:
- Total is sometimes a bit "Europe heavy". Employees outside of Europe may not be as involved as they could/should be.
- Total has much "paperwork" (not uncommon for big companies) to get things done.

job_title: Technical Service Engineer in Houston, TX
pros: They have a good benefits package and one of the best 401K matching programs.  They also have a really nice flex time option.  It is an alternating 980 schedule, but instead of every other Friday off, you get one Friday per month.  It helps to stretch your vacation.  In general, the people who work there are very qualified and knowlegeable.  They used to have great safety lunches (once per quarter) and would award nice non-compensatory gifts for participation and good performance.
cons: They are very compartmentalized, and territorial, especially between corporate and R&D.  Management used inappropriate metrics for measuring employee productivity.  Perception of work seemed of more value than actual work.

pros:
* Safe place to work; There were no redundancies in Upstream during the recent oil price crash
* Smart people to work with and learn from
* Interesting technical work
cons:
* Slow to change: The company likes to advertise innovation, but in reality is slow to make real changes
* You must speak French to succeed at higher levels. There is a real language barrier at the mid to high levels.
* It is difficult to navigate the bureaucracy. There are many managers and often no clear line of reporting. 
* The IT system is very difficult to manage. So much focus on security makes operating a video conference with an external vendor almost impossible.

job_title: Lab Chemist (La Porte Research and Technology Center) in La Porte, TX
pros: Genuinely good people; misery loves company but the company is good. Total is the perfect place if you're fresh out of school or if you've been put out to pasture and simply want to finish the 2-3 years before retirement in a stress free environment. Think Adult Retirement Daycare Center.
cons: Incompetent management from the top down. There is a mass exodus of engineers, chemists, and operators leaving the company. The safety program is in shambles with the new shared services consolidation and it's only a matter of time before a catastrophic incident occurs. Poor communication and dismal morale. Chemists fresh out of school come in at a higher pay rate than tenured chemists. I don't know a single person here who isn't looking for another job at the moment, myself included.

review_title: I wish every success of TOTAL
pros:
It is great to work for a company like TOTAL that is open to new ideas and truly cares for their employees. I have worked at TOTAL for more than 02 years and have really enjoyed growing with the company. 
The culture at TOTAL is conducive to team development that combined with the people here makes this a great place to work. I am given tools and resources and with the help of those I can go as far as I want in this career. 
TOTAL is firmly committed to its values, diversity, workforce safety & security, environment and social commitments. TOTAL promotes and nurtures sharing culture that enables supportive and connected environment where everyone feels accepted and supported
cons: Don't do cost cutting activities.

review_title: Good place to start your career
pros: Good company, life & work balance, nice people to work with, flexible schedule, good benefit
cons: if you are not French, your sky is limited. They do not develop US talent. Lower compensation than peers. High turn over for technical people. No plan on how to making more profit, only know how to cut people and budget.

review_title: Total is 2nd or 3rd quartile Company in terms of pay and perceived value of their employees.
job_title: Technical Service Engineer in Houston, TX
pros: The plant operators are non-union (in Houston) and easy to work with.
cons: There is not a career plan so your future path is very uncertain and somewhat up to you, but mainly who you know.  They also do not have a medical plan after retirement.

job_title: Sales Representative in New York, NY
pros: Working with Total gives me the opportunity to meet others and i was able to  learnt a lot from my senior ones,it increase my way of  thinking and  ability to get things done in a very simple ways, every employees are hard working and  work smart,they satisfy every Costumers in a intelligent ways,they also treat employees in a  very good way
cons: Well, for me i don"t think i ever experienced any down time, because i really enjoyed  my work, everything about the company is perfect

review_title: Well known company but not the best place to grow
pros:
- friendly environment and collaborative colleagues 
- flat structure so you will be able to work on various project and directly report to senior managers 
- good first experience because thanks to the structure you will be able to see different part of the business
cons:
- lack or emergency / everything is slow 
- not much challenges
- salary below the market 
- no opportunity to get promoted unless you know the right people 
- management decisions are not clear 
- French environnement 
- Not much possibility to move internally (even though the company has offices all around the world)

review_title: It has been a good experience, but I am looking past this job for better ones.
job_title: Mechanical Engineer Co-op in Port Arthur, TX
pros: I cannot say this about every team on site, but the team I work with is great. They show great teamwork and communication skills. They have been out here a long time and know what they are doing.
cons: The company is very understaffed and underpaid. This company does not pay their salaried employees over time if they come in on the weekends, unlike the company down the road.

review_title: The troglodyte within a supposedly innovative sector!
pros: It's an interesting sector and Total G&P have relatively large market share.
cons:
Archaic culture, the likes of which I've never encountered! Time stamping in/out, no internet access, no mobile phone use, desk top computers, outdated systems/tech, dreary offices.
Ineffectual management - middle and senior management seem to have been in place for decades and seem to have done nothing to modernise their approach to the market.
I'm not aware of any other business with such outdated operations and cultures!

pros: No layoff worries at Total. Shops in the US are very lean and upper management relies on attrition to  reduce head count, not layoffs. Very comforting in times of recession or low crude prices. Very structured management (could be considered a con), but quality people through out organization especially at the staff level.
cons: Not super competitive on salaries, and very slow to move people around and up. Young employees who are talented usually get frustrated with how long they are kept in the same role and leave before they can move up. Chemical engineers routinely get first pick of openings.

pros: A very strong technically acknowledged  position combined with a more recent business acumen. The place to be if you own or want to develop technical skills. High level training and quick accountability to rookies. More and more international culture. Speaking french more a should than a must. Better compensation scheme that it may look at first glance.
cons:
"French package" somehow difficult to be compared to an anglosaxon "all in one".
Cash bonuses still way behind other companies, partially compensated by shares.

review_title: Opportunity for growth is not extended to everyone.
pros: For the industry pay is fairly competitive, annual bonus structure, flexible work schedules
cons: No career growth unless you are viewed as "key staff". HR and management will only work to develop the careers of those who are favored. HR staff is full of younger people who are very immature and if they do not like you they will make you feel it. Management can treat their staff with disrespect and the Executives will back management no matter what. As the years have passed I have noticed the decline in moral and increase in resignations. I blame HR and management for how they set the tone for the office.

review_title: Good FRENCH company in the US
pros: Great learning ground. A fair compensation package. Knowledgeable colleagues who are willing to share their experience along with their wins.
cons: For a company promoting a collaborative “One Total” spirit , now “One Country” initiative, a common discussion among cultural peers is the reality of a new and dictatorial feel to TOTAL. A common generalization of the French culture is its indifference to input from “outsiders”. Unfortunately, whether they are willing to admit it or not, this generalization is beginning to come to life at the “multi-national” TOTAL SA.

review_title: I've been here for 25 years + and this a very stable and career opportunity orientated place to work.
pros: Stable employment here with the opportunity to move up in the Company. Pay is very fair now and it seems we may begin to receive bonuses in operations like the other large Companies in this comparison.
cons: Shift work is the majority of the work if you can manage the days and nights. There is overtime here so you can increase your yearly income.

pros: The best things that I get from Internship at TOTAL are they teach me how it feels to be an engineer at the total company by involving activities which the duty is almost equivalent to permanent workers such as presenting every week the new technology or issue in total in front of the workers.
cons: Due to they treat me like a real employee, therefore I need to push my self to understand and learn about the new issue in electrical departments. However, it is help me become as professional workers

review_title: Good local people, questionable decisions at the executive and global level
pros:
Nice family atmosphere in the plants
Many learning opportunities
Promote within company
cons:
Currently too focused on short-term savings
Take way too long to make hiring positions and replace vacant positions, if at all
Very heavy work load
Relatively low pay

pros: The benefits are good and the people are generally very intelligent.  The work is challenging and the industry is interesting.
cons: Silo management, completely top down.  The oil prices make it a bad time to switch into the industry in my opinion.  The new CEO has a strong personality and tends to force all decisions to his opinion.  That has been a problem throughout his career and it may put the entire company at risk.  Nobody is right all the time.

pros: Excellent salary for the area plus the company have a generous pension scheme, a good share scheme and you have the option of either a 9-day fortnight or flexible working.
cons: Penny wise and pound daft. They seem to be on a 3-year cycle of repeating the same management initiatives only re-branded. Offices are absolutely dire and some of the decisions taken by senior management can only be described as bizzare.

pros: Neon and Clarix are truly the best products in the wound care industry. Once the customer realized it was a universal allograft, could be used over bone, and didn't have adverse affects they were SOLD.
cons: When I was there, they were in the middle of finalized studies to get reimbursement for the products. This was the most thing about the company because doctors would want to use the product then we weren't able to get it in the facility.

review_title: It's a good time to work for Total
pros: Total in the US is a good place to work. The company is investing a tremendous amount in the US right now, which means they are committed to the country and the people who work for them. The management is fair and the people are friendly, especially at the sites in the area. There is a world of opportunity here for employees.
cons: This is a French company and the culture is hierarchical. But once you know that and accept it, you can work efficiently and effectively.

review_title: International oil and gas company with lots of opportunities
pros:
International presence with possibilities to move around the world for those who prove they are worth it. 
Overall good package and a company who  takes care of its employees (there can be some exceptions)
Things are moving and focus is more and more on leadership skills, open mind, etc.
cons:
Still not completely diversified (mostly French) but this is changing. 
Packages are being reduced which could make the company less attractive

review_title: Good experience.  There for 27 years in various functions across many disciplines.  Very flexible
job_title: Manager -Industrial Services and Capital Purchasing in Houston, TX
pros: Flexibility in career path and in opportunities to change and create change, but only to a certain level.  I have stayed for 28 years so I am obviously happy, but could be happier.
cons: Low pay for American employees.  Company is too French not quick enough for Americans to move to the top.  We get too frustrated.

review_title: A great company overall; HR needs improvement
job_title: Lab Chemist (La Porte Research and Technology Center) in La Porte, TX
pros: The Research and Technology center overall is a good place to work.  There are opportunities to advance your career, especially if you have a master's degree or higher.  I have learned a lot working here, and think it's a great way to start a career in Gas and Oil.  They provide training opportunities as well.  Also, the benefits package and 401k contribution is pretty good.  They have a strong safety record and safety programs that are enforced very well.
cons:
Management is run differently at the Research and Technology Center than at the corporate site.  I think our managers here are very good at what they do; however, the manager of human resources needs to change.  She is not very professional or progressive when it comes to a research center, and employees below the supervisor level get the impression that she sees us as children that need micromanaging.  We did have a different head of HR for about two years and the difference was very apparent.  He was professional, and in being so gave everyone else the feeling of professionalism.  A favorite saying around here is "the beatings will stop once morale improves."  Management always says that they are willing to listen to the employee, and have even held meetings and such to do so.  Though I have yet to see the results or outcomes of these meetings.

Bonuses and raises can be very hit or miss, depending heavily on how the company is doing, and even how your department is doing that year.  Some years the bonus was a few hundred dollars; this year it was a couple thousand.  And as a rule, no Christmas bonuses.

review_title: I've heard good things about working at plant sites, but experience at corporate office has been discouraging
pros: Good compensation, benefits, and some very knowledgeable people around.
cons:
High workload.
Lacks formal training on technical subjects related to functions.  
Lacks team building initiatives, coordination, and freedom to make changes.  There seems to be an issue with trust and friendliness among some employees, and it shows.
Too many reports.  Daily reports, weekly reports, monthly reports.  Reports for peers, reports for managers, reports for Paris.

pros: Great people, moderately relaxed environment and an easy life if that’s what you are after.
cons: Salary does not match industry average, lack of work for most of the department but will still continue to recruit and a massive lack of progression for anyone who would like to advance in their own career.

pros: Family benefits, good pay, decent life style, management is open t your questions and tries to help you whenever needed, although some managers don't deserve to be even in the company
cons: Not many disadvantages,  I would rather say that it is difficul to change job post or country easily as the organization is huge and not so flexible... but other than that it's a decent company

job_title: Process Operator in Port Arthur, TX
pros:
Great compensation, in line with local industry.
It's a huge business, and feels very professional from the top down.
Safety is taken seriously.
Great coworkers of all types.
Union.
cons: Work/home balance leans heavily to the work side. It is expected, and anyone who knows this line of work knows that most of your time will be spent at work. Excessive overtime can hurt morale, but most accept that the pay makes time at your second home bearable.

review_title: Don't stay at LOR here unless you wish to be grumpy for rest of your career
pros: Health Plans worth joining up for
cons: Surrounded by a miserable majority of people who only live for the weekend. Safety at LOR shockingly slack, corner cutting is acceptable and get the impression most employees don't like it here

review_title: my internship in Total, a good place to learn.
pros:
free hour of work,
great staff I worked for innovation departement with a very qualified staff.
My supervisor leave me lot of freedom in my job: direction of the project....
cons:
after, the internship, HR is supicious about your background.
a good internship doesn't have the value of a good diploma.
I am from university, Total hire only engineer.

pros: Because the company is French there are a lot of personal benefits. People understand you have a life, good vacation and benefits packages, reasonable hours.
cons: Because the company is French (also) things can move slowly. Patience is a virtue and not getting too invested is your best bet.

review_title: Great company.  Stiff for young ambitious people
pros: Very well-established company. Funds for projects. Great benefits. Great variety of positions and metiers within the company.
cons: Old-school: the company's long history makes it stiff. You need a diploma from X, ENS or HEC to have access to high positions. Managers are very bright ex-students basically. Promotions should be more based on merit. It's a shame since there is so much diversity among the 100,000+ employees.

pros: Flexible work hours, humane company cultures, work life balance is encouraged , relatively friendly work environment, performance shares reward for deserving employees
cons: Poor cash bonus, top management not strict enough, staff training improving now but still needs more budget. Politics and forming of cliques by some staff creates room for unjust promotions at times

review_title: OK if you have no other options
pros: A big company so if you are willing to relocate, it can be good. You will have a lot of expatriate experiences. Job security is good.
cons: Salary could be lower compared to other big oil and gas companies. Promotion will be slow and you will not be considered the same as French people. Just like other reviewers said, too many French people in the upper hierarchy.

review_title: Great company, but in need of an overhaul
pros: Stable employment, job security, work/life balance, competitive salary, great opportunities for growth and for international assignments, as well as for horizontal career moves.
cons: Outdated management model based on "command and control" approach, timid opening to new management models, lack of internationalization in top management positions.

review_title: Support from everyone is unlimited and has a wonderful work environment
job_title: Marketing and Sales Executive in Bay Pines, FL
pros: The Senior management is focused completely on supporting the lower level to achieve the objectives. Unlimited support is there 24 x 7 and can rely upon them always
cons: The support from channel partners are lacking a bit, but the company is in the mode of Pushing them to develop the business of channel partners

pros: Multi-National Oil Company, Challenging environment, diverse group of people to work with in and out of the company. Global company policies and culture is being passed on to the local office with their best effort.
cons: Not much room for growth for high-potentials. Tenure is highly valued. Straightforward doing of business and working with colleagues may sometimes be difficult. Still a bit bureaucratic.

pros:
Efficient professional development opportunities (trainings, experts, peer reviews).
Work/Personal time balance is optimal; you can afford a good quality time with the family.
cons: If you are on the expatriate contract, you will have to move quite often. So it's better to weigh your options before commitment.

pros: Total is one of the leading petroleum companies in the word. Working at is a great opportunity to reach a high level of professionalism
cons: The job of a project engineer at Total is not an easy task, Total is a functional structure so obtaining the level of engagement of staholders needed to reach projects sucess criteria is always a heavy task and quite complicated

pros: An opportunity to supervise team of more than 15 staff was owesome team work at its best listening and Avery big opportunity learn a lot especially through their seminars

pros: Great advantages, fair pay, a lot, lots of vacation and paid holidays, nice canteen, flexible hours (until 9:30am to 5 pm)
cons: Not hiring, constant organization change, need to know about this field’s technical aspects very well. Very hard to be promoted or get more paid after many years there. Hire ups will put a lot of obstacles in your way so you don’t get more paid or promoted

pros: Great work environment, and lots of room for growth, people are very nice, and its a huge corporation very reputable
cons: It is difficult to get hired by the company but once you get in you are in for good. sometimes there might be a lot of work to do however you are the only one responsible to complete them

pros: International company, good managers. International presence, good pool of competences and a diffused professional attitude. Good place to learn, both on technical matters and management habits.
cons: Questionable image and reputation attached to the company, especially in certain locations. Not so good management of employees, particularly in the lower management.

pros: Well, there is so much that can be said about Total E&P Angola. 1- The Company is committed to Safety First in each and all FPSOs, offices and the entire working sector (Onshore & Offshore). 2- Apply the Golden Rules. 3 - Anti-corruption. 4- Considers all races and gender. Plus, is an amazing and multicultural company for all times.
cons: On this field, there almost nothing to mention. though there might be some Cons but, that is normal and it happen in each and all Institutions.

pros: They have contact me with the job opportunities and explained the procedure.They ask me to pay 75$ for the registration first I refused to pay bcuz I didn't believe them but after getting assurance I have proceeded further.Their commitment is good.But I received my offer letter 2days late by the time they mentioned.Anyway I got Job in TOTAL in UAE location.

review_title: Good company if you are near the end of your career or you are mainly looking for stability.
pros:
Great job security
Management cares about employees
The culture is much more relaxed and they care about your work life balance.
cons:
Pay is quite low compared to competitors in the industry.
No trainings or any resources given to improve yourself.
Slow to adapt newer technologies.

review_title: Great company with amazing carrer opportunities if you are willing to work abroad in third world countries
pros: size, salary, networking with experts worldwide, techniques, reserve security with going deep offshore, great sunny future... great canteen! smily french personel!
cons: might not recognize your contribution, but this is because of the size. can sometimes be not flexible to match your expectations specifically with regards to expatriation.

review_title: a various experience in a company facing many challenges
pros: TOTAL is a good international company offering opportunities in many countries with a good sense of diversity and the possibility to change internally between jobs and places.
cons: the fact that Total has headquarters in France could be viewed perhaps by the international employees as an handicap due to a weak job market in this country

review_title: International oil company but still very French!
pros: A major oil company with worldwide operations both onshore and offshore, allowing you to work in an excellent multicultural and diverse environment.
cons: Although a multicultural international company, with English as the main language for meetings, it does slip into being a French company with regards to starting meetings on time, long lunch breaks etc.

review_title: Excellent mix of people with experience and newer employees with fresh insight.
pros: The people!  Most jobs allow you to be responsible for a variety of related responsibilities. The financial strength of the Company allows it to weather the cyclical nature of the industry.
cons: There has been a tremendous amount of change over the last few years. Also, there are more organizational changes pending. Many of the changes have occurred at the senior management level.

pros: As young engineer, we have access to a lot of opportunities of training (technical, management,...), careers,... If you have some motivation, you can grow in this company and stay your all career!
cons: The company values are really good and the work-life balance is also good. We work hard but we also have a lot of compensation so we can enjoy and spent time with our family and frinds.

job_title: Sales Engineer in Ho Chi Minh City

cons: May not be for some. Really demanding and hard working environment. Work life balance could be difficult at times because of travel and demanding goals. Management leads by example and works really hard and is aware though.

review_title: No training, didn't communicate expectations, no medical prep for working in Africa
pros: Time off on 24/24 rotation was undisturbed, severance pay was generous
cons: No training whatsoever for an offshore supervisory position where mistakes are enormously costly. No communication of expectations or criteria for success. Shocking lack of preparation/review of procedures for offshore well completion and subsea installation activities. No medical preparation, shots/vaccines, or malaria medication for working in West Africa.  Difficulty navigating the politics of a French company.

pros: Good company to work for in france. There's a lot of advantages and a lot of money, when you need something you generally got it.
